explanation: The condition used x>a+1 which skips the case x == a+1 incorrectly. The intended check is whether x is strictly greater than a and at most b (a < x <= b). I fixed the condition to x>a so it correctly handles values immediately above a.
fixed_code:
a,b,c,x=list(map(int,input().split()))
ans=1.0
if x>a and x<=b:
    ans=c/(b-a)
elif x>b:
    ans=0.0
print('%.10f'%ans)
